body:
Comment 9: 
"For those working from source, who are fewer in number, the situation is easy to
understand."

It's easy to understand if you already know what's going on.
I understand the reasoning behind the behaviour, but it still took me
a couple of hours looking in the wrong place before I found the problem.

At least a warning indicating that go install isn't installing
into the usual place might be useful to tip people off that
something unusual is going on. Or install in *both* places.

> The "go tool" command should look in the tool directory, nowhere else.

I agree with this.
